annonstext:
Overview and purpose of the role

We are looking to expand the team by bringing on board an additional Solution Analyst to work multi-nationally across our European markets within a well-known global brand.

The Solution Analyst will support with implementation of Navision as a GL system across Europe, as well any continuous improvements required by business during the post-implementation period. The ideal candidate will be an expert in Navision (especially finance & accounting), able to understand business needs and to translate these into effective solutions.

Additionally, the role holder will be a strong communicator at all levels of the organization, able to communicate complex information in a user-friendly way and able to work and communicate cross-culturally.

The location is flexible within EMEA. Ideally in Warsaw, Gothenburg.

Key responsibilities:

	Gather requirements, plan, design and implement solutions for all parts of the organisation
	Work closely with business stakeholders, across multiple departments and countries, so they are able to realise the potential of various solutions
	Analyse business requirements to understand needs for solution modifications
	Assess systems capabilities and validate the feasibility of the proposed solutions
	Ensure understanding of any changes or updates to solutions, undertaking full testing, and communicating changes as needed
	Control and ensure release processes are secured.
	Support the solution development process by providing business and technical best practices and identifying functionalities necessary to cover business needs
	Recommend metrics to measure the performance of the solutions in run-time, identifying opportunities for solution improvement
	Validate the functional and technical specifications and test cases
	Provide business expertise and knowledge in simple or complex process flows and mapping with applications, group of applications, or applications sub-portfolios
	Support project team with the implementation of solutions

Education and Professional experience:

	University degree or specialized diploma in Finance / Computer Science
	5+ years experience with configuration / changes in Navision 
	5+ years experience with projects / continuous improvements related to GL tools
	Very good business analysis & documentation skills
	Ideally will have experience working with multiple solutions in across multiple countries
	Good knowledge of finance is a major plus

Competencies and skills

Essential:

	Process oriented
	Able to understand business needs and translate into effective actions
	Strong communication skills – able to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization and cross-culturally
	Able to effectively challenge business stakeholders thiking in a positive and constructive way
	Ability to say “no” in a constructive way and suggest alternatives 
	Pro-activen, driven with high perseverance
	Strong problem solving skills, identifying, structuring, monitoring and delivering results
	Strong planning and analytical skills
	Strong interpersonal skills, building and maintaining strong relationships with stakeholders
	Analytical skills and effective problem solving
	Highly experienced in working with Navision
	Advanced level of General IT skills
	Advanced level of English (oral/written). An additional European language(s) is desirable
	Ability to travel internationally – potentially frequently at times depending on the level of support the market needs
	Self-driven and able to work remotely

Desirable:

	A good understanding of the VFS business and processes
	Experience in, or understanding of, the asset finance industry
	Experience of project management in the Financial Services industry
	Experience of working multi-nationally across EMEA
